avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. There is usually not enough snow for snow sports and avalanches can hardly be triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lack of snow and stones are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is no closed snow cover, snowpack and the terrain is mostly bare.

weatherForecast.comment: The sun is shining on Monday. Visibility is good on the mountains. Thin, high cloud fields will pass through at times. It will be a little cooler. Temperatures at 2000 metres will be around 2 degrees. Weak southerly wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. Small avalanches in particular can occasionally be triggered by one person in shady slope high alpine regions above 2600 metres. This is where the older and fresh foehn drift snow has formed a suitable shelf above a weak layer (usually in persistent weak layer). In addition to the risk of burial, the risk of falling and injury should be taken into account.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Rare avalanche prone locations in persistent weak layers of snow

snowpackStructure.comment: On the sunny slopes, the snow cover, snowpack is moistened up to high altitudes during the daytime changes. On the shady slope, it often remains hard-frozen on the surface, below which there is partly unbound edged snow at altitude, which can serve as a weak layer in exceptional cases. This is the case, for example, over the hard old snow from early winter. The snow depth is well below average at all altitudes.

weatherForecast.comment: The sun is shining on Monday. Visibility is good on the mountains. Thin, high cloud fields will pass through at times. It will be a little cooler. Temperatures at 2000 m around 2 degrees, at 3000 m around -3 degrees. Moderate to brisk southerly winds with peaks around 50 km/h.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Only very rarely can drift snow packs be triggered by individuals in shady slopes, avalanches remain small. In areas adjacent to the ridgeline, crest or summit, there are very occasional trigger points for small avalanches that are difficult to disturb, even in persistent weak layers.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Injury from stones and falling are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow depth is well below average for the time of year, low to medium elevations and the sunny slopes are widely covered in snow. The snow cover, snowpack is moistened up to high altitudes on the sunny slopes during daytime changes, in the shade it often remains frozen hard. At high altitudes on the shady slopes, weak layers of faceted crystals are occasionally preserved in the snow cover, mostly in the vicinity of crusts.

weatherForecast.comment: The sun is shining on Monday. Visibility is good on the mountains. Thin, high cloud fields will pass through at times. It will be a little cooler. Temperatures at 2000 m around 2 degrees, at 3000 m around -3 degrees. Weak to moderate southerly winds with gusts of around 40 km/h.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: In high and high alpine, shady locations isolated avalanche prone locations
